Title: CNBC News Operations Manager
RoleDescription:
Managers in news operations will be responsible for knowing the ins and outs of how the teams they support work at every level. They will be a regular presence everywhere news is made - in the newsroom, the control room, in the field. The ideal candidate will have a keen understanding of editorial and production processes and will be passionate about optimizing workflows, creatively solving complex issues, and contributing to the overall success of CNBC. 

You will work closely with your team to turn insight into action - searching for actionable solutions to problems, connecting story tellers with technical stakeholders, and engaging the newsroom in conversation about what's working, what's broken, and how to fix it. You will ensure teams are fully supported in their mission of bringing world-class journalism to our audience.

ResponsibilitiesOwn relationships with editorial stakeholders to understand their workflow needs and pain points and provide general operational support to the editorial mission of the news brands of Versant - chiefly, CNBC.Lead analysts as they document as-is workflows, identify ways to standardize processes, conduct analysis to identify key metrics, understand performance, uncover areas ripe for optimization or improvementProactively research, evaluate and recommend innovative technology solutions to address areas of need and future-proof workflowsWork with cross-functional teams - including product, development and engineering - to integrate technology solutions into editorial team workflowsOffer ongoing support to ensure successful implementation and adoption of process improvementsDevelop training materials, lead trainings, and provide guidance to stakeholders on new and updated workflows and technologyEstablish and implement quality assurance measures to ensure adherence to standardized workflowsEnsure editorial teams receive the same level of support and attention no matter the platforms they serve, nor the time of day they work.When news calls you answer - you're ready to work odd hours including the occasional night, early morning, or holiday as news events demand.Qualifications5+ Years of Relevant ExperienceYou're fluent in at least one of these areas of journalism: TV, digital video, or modern print.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to evaluate complex processesProficient in process mapping and flowcharting techniques to visually represent and analyze workflowsFamiliarity with workflow management software and tools (Visio, Figma, Lucidchart etc.)Advanced skills using Microsoft Excel and PowerPointStrategic mindset and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environmentStrong interpersonal skillsBachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in relevant field
